relation: Maps rows to query servers based on the partitioning of a table or index using the rowid of the row to UPDATE/DELETE.

Maps rows to query servers based on the partitioning of a table or index using a set of columns. Used for partial partition-wise join, PARALLEL INSERT, CREATE TABLE AS SELECT of a partitioned table, and CREATE PARTITIONED GLOBAL INDEX.
Maps rows to query servers using a hash function on the join key. Used for PARALLEL JOIN or PARALLEL GROUP BY.
Maps rows to query servers using ranges of the sort key. Used when the statement contains an ORDER BY clause.
Randomly maps rows to query servers.
Broadcasts the rows of the entire table to each query server. Used for a parallel join when one table is very small compared to the other.
The QC consumes the input in order, from the first to the last query server. Used when the statement contains an ORDER BY clause.
The QC consumes the input randomly. Used when the statement does not have an ORDER BY clause.
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {9242=For example, in the following explain plan, the last step is a very unselective range scan that is executed 76563 times, accesses 11432983 rows, throws away 99% of them, and retains 76563 rows. Why access 11432983 rows to realize that only 76563 rows are needed?}
textBeforeTable: Table 12-2 Values of DISTRIBUTION Column of the PLAN_TABLE Table 12-2 describes the values that can appear in the DISTRIBUTION column: Name of the query block, either system-generated or defined by the user with the QB_NAME hint. VARCHAR2(30) QBLOCK_NAME Elapsed time in seconds of the operation as estimated by query optimization. For statements that use the rule-based approach, this column is null. NUMBER(20,2) TIME Expressions produced by the operation. VARCHAR2(4000) PROJECTION Predicates used to filter rows before producing them. VARCHAR2(4000) FILTER_PREDICATES Predicates used to locate rows in an access structure. For example, start or stop predicates for an index range scan. VARCHAR2(4000) ACCESS_PREDICATES Temporary space, in bytes, used by the operation as estimated by the query optimizer's approach. textAfterTable: Table 12-3 lists each combination of OPERATION and OPTIONS produced by the EXPLAIN PLAN statement and its meaning within an execution plan. Table 12-3 OPERATION and OPTIONS Values Produced by EXPLAIN PLAN Operation Option Description AND-EQUAL   Operation accepting multiple sets of rowids, returning the intersection of the sets, eliminating duplicates. Used for the single-column indexes access path. BITMAP CONVERSION TO ROWIDS converts bitmap representations to actual rowids that can be used to access the table. FROM ROWIDS converts the rowids to a bitmap representation. COUNT returns the number of rowids if the actual values are not needed. BITMAP INDEX SINGLE VALUE looks up the bitmap for
